polynomial

Class PolynomialImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • polynomial.PolynomialImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Polynomial

    public class PolynomialImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynomial
    This class represents a specific polynomial list. It is pointed to the head of a list of polynomials.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PolynomialImpl()
      Creates a blank polynomial.
      PolynomialImpl(java.lang.String input)
      This constructor creates a polynomial based on a string input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PolynomialImpl

        public PolynomialImpl()
        Creates a blank polynomial.

      • PolynomialImpl

        public PolynomialImpl(java.lang.String input)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor creates a polynomial based on a string input. The input must be a string, where "x" is the variable name. The terms must be separated by a single space.
        Parameters:
        input - Input the string containing the polynomial.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws the exception if the string does not follow the format specified.

    • Method Detail

      • addTerm

        public void addTerm(int coefficient,
                    int degree)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a term to the polynomial. The new term takes the coefficient and power from the input. If the polynomial already has a term with the same degree, the coefficients will be added together.
        Specified by:
        addTerm in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        coefficient - The coefficient of the polynomial.
        degree - The power of the polynomial.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will throw exception if the power is negative.

        Get the highest degree of this polynomial.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Returns the degree as an integer.

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(java.lang.Double digit)
        Calculates the parameter given the number for x. If result is too large, will output Infinity for positive large number or a NaN for negative.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        digit - Evaluate the function using this double.
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the function.

      • add

        public Polynomial add(Polynomial p)
        Adds two polynomials together. This will create a new polynomial and will not mutate any of the polynomials.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Polynomial
        Parameters:
        p - The polynomial to add.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of the two polynomials.
